answers.text: large boulders that carve long scratches in the bedrock

qas.question: What can scientists deduct from the direction of the striations?

answers.text: lines of crescent-shape depressions in the rock underlying a glacier
abrasion when boulders in the glacier are repeatedly caught and released

qas.question: What is formed when glaciers lack boulders?
What helps scientists determine the speed of a glacier?
What is formed when glaciers crush boulders?
